title: 112_hr2557
content: Establishment of a Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will establish the Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee to advise on interagency coordination, communication, and collaboration efforts to address tick-borne diseases. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee aims to minimize overlap in efforts, coordinate with other agencies and organizations, ensure interagency communication, represent diverse scientific viewpoints, and advise on priorities related to Lyme and tick-borne diseases. Members are appointed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services from individuals outside the Federal Government. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee is composed of appointed members from various backgrounds, including the scientific community, tick-borne disease organizations, and healthcare providers. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee includes members from the scientific community, tick-borne disease organizations, healthcare providers, patient representatives, and state representatives. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee includes patient representatives with personal or family experience, state and local health department representatives, and members with diverse scientific perspectives. The Secretary also designates nonvoting ex officio members. The Secretary ensures diversity of scientific perspectives among Committee members. Ex officio members from various Federal agencies are designated as nonvoting members. The Secretary appoints Committee members with diverse scientific perspectives. Ex officio members from Federal agencies serve as nonvoting members. The Committee includes co-chairpersons appointed by the Secretary and a public co-chairperson elected by members. Each appointed member serves a 4-year term, with vacancies filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The Committee members serve a 4-year term and vacancies are filled in the same manner as the original appointment. Meetings are held at least twice a year with additional meetings called by the co-chairpersons. The Committee holds public meetings at least twice a year, with additional meetings as needed. Agenda items can be added by members, and records are maintained as required by law. The Committee submits an annual report describing its functions to the Secretary. The Committee, through the Directors of CDC and NIH, submits an annual report to the Secretary detailing its functions, members, activities, and recommendations. $250,000 is authorized annually for the Act's implementation from 2012 to 2016. Authorization of Appropriations: $250,000 is authorized annually for fiscal years 2012 through 2016 to carry out the Act, covering expenses and per diem costs for the Committee under the Federal Advisory Committee Act. Voting members cannot be permanent salaried employees.
